oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Modification of ground and excited states of 3-phenylureidoquinoline by encapsulation in surfactant assemblies
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PANDA, DEBASHIS
DATTA, ANINDYA
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ground states
spectrochemical analysis
fluorescence
organic compounds
excited states
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The interaction of the fluorescent probe 3-phenylureidoquinoline with surfactant assemblies has been investigated using fluorescence spectroscopic and computational techniques. The non-radiative deactivation rates are found to be suppressed in micelles. In the negatively charged SDS micelle, the cation is found to form, leading to a marked shift in fluorescence. This is explained by a consideration of the local pH and altered pKa of the fluorophore. In reverse micelle the gradual addition of water remarkably enhances the rate of non-radiative depopulation.
